reference.title: Extended functionality
reference.shortdesc: DITA-OT provides additional code reference processing support beyond that which is mandated by the DITA specification. These extensions can be used to define character encodings or line ranges for use in code blocks.

section.title: Character set definition
section.p: DITA-OT supports defining the code reference target file encoding using the format attribute. The supported format is:

If a character set is not defined, the system default character set will be used. If the character set is not recognized or supported, the DOTJ052E error is thrown and the system default character set is used as a fall-back.

section.title: Line range extraction
section.p: Code references can be limited to extract only a specified line range by defining the line-range pointer in the URI fragment. The format is:
Start and end line numbers start from 1 and are inclusive. If the end range is omitted, the range ends on the last line of the file.

example.p: Only lines from 5 to 10 will be included in the output.

section.title: RFC 5147
section.p: DITA-OT implements line position and range from . The format for line range is:

Start and end line numbers start from 0 and are inclusive and exclusive, respectively. If the start range is omitted, the range starts from the first line; if the end range is omitted, the range ends on the last line of the file. The format for line position is:

example.p: Only lines from 5 to 10 will be included in the output.
